title.value: Антипролиферативная и антивирусная активность интерферона и индукторов интерферона в системе in vitro
Antiproliferative and antiviral activity of interferon and interferon inducers in vitro
Antiproliferative and antiviral activity of interferon and interferon inducers in vitro

journal.title: Agriculture - Problems and Prospects : collection of scientific papers

person.name: Grinchik, I.T., National Academy of Sciences. Scientific and Practical Center of Animal Breding (Belarus). The S.N. Vyshelesskij Inst. of Experimental Veterinary Medicine
Prokulevich, V.A., Belarus State Univ., Minsk (Belarus)

abstract.value: Studying of antiproliferative and antiviral activities of recombinant swine interferon (manufacturer SCP 'Belagrogen', Gorki, Mogilyov area), preparation 'Miksoferon' (recombinant human interferon), manufacturer JSC 'Mosagrogen', and interferon inducers in vitro with use of SPEV culture cells and virus of porcine transmissible gastroenteritis (TGE) were conducted. As interferon inducers used vaccinal virus strains of Newcastle illness: 'La-Sota' and 'В1', 'Воr', an hens infectious bronchitis (Н-120) and interferon inducer of prolonged action 'Provest', manufacturer of OC 'Diafarm' (Novosibirsk area, Berdsk-10) It was established that swine recombinant interferon demonstrates the antiproliferative activity at SPEV culture cells in dilutions from 1:100 to 1:800 accompanied by degeneration of the cell monolayer. It was established that swine recombinant interferon and the long-acting interferon inducer of 'Provest' demonstrate the antiviral activity at SPEV culture cells after its inoculation with TGE virus under the experimental conditions. Antiviral activity of these preparations was appeared 6 hours after their inoculation into the cell culture and lasting for 72-96 hours.
